meanings.definition: The internal parts of the body, especially the organs.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the innard carefully during the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The innard of the computer needed to be replaced to fix the issue.
meanings.sent3: The innard of the clock seemed to have a mind of its own, ticking irregularly.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the innard of her personality, always caring for others.
meanings.sent5: The innard of the mystery novel revealed the true culprit in the end.

meanings.definition: The inner parts or workings of something.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the innard of the machine helped him fix it quickly.
meanings.sent2: The innard of the plan was carefully hidden from the public.
meanings.sent3: The innard of the joke was so clever that everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The innard of the problem was finally exposed after hours of investigation.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the innard of the ancient ruins revealed hidden treasures.
